experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
responsibilities: Developed a modular retrieval system for profile data across 20 C#/.NET APIs, reducing API and database calls by up to 80% in 75% of cases, improving performance and infrastructure load
Designed and implemented partial profile update and caching mechanisms using Kafka consumers, enabling targeted cache refreshes to lighten processing load
Built a C# console app and supporting API routes to streamline PDF generation and storage of customer enrollment data; utilized application in automated jobs with JAMS
Increased maintainability with comprehensive unit tests and by auditing repositories for deprecated code

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.company: BYU J. Reuben Clark Law School
responsibilities: Led backend development team for law.byu.edu and other BYU Law sites, implementing secure handling of user data and access control measures, including SSO and MFA
Configured and maintained secure cloud architecture for law.byu.edu and cpcr.byu.edu (AWS)
Enhanced security, functionality, and maintainability of BYU Law's internal information system's Node.js backend through refactoring of code architecture

experience.title: Teaching Assistant (Data Communications & Enterprise Application Development)
responsibilities: Contributed to curriculum development and student assistance in topics related to data communications (especially TCP/IP networking) and application development (particularly with ASP .NET)
Graded assignments including code repositories, AWS infrastructure stacks, and full development projects

experience.title: IT Specialist
responsibilities: Managed system privileges, network configuration, and access control for DCE's appx. 800 employees, including compliance with organizational security policies
Resolved technical issues to support secure and efficient IT environment

projectsAndSkills.portfolio: Click here to see my work!

portfolio.name: ARCHIVIST (CAPSTONE PROJECT)
portfolio.description: Archivist is an AI-supported file management assistant. It organizes and names files automatically in relevant and logical structures and provides a chatbot which understands the filesystem's content and provides thorough, competent responses to questions. Archivist is in development and far from complete. You can follow its progress at the links below.

portfolio.name: THIS WEBSITE (v4.0)
portfolio.description: This simple website is the fourth major version of my personal portfolio website (you can see v1 and v2 below, but I ended up scrapping v3 before it ever made it online). It consists of a Node.js backend and a React frontend, containerized with Docker and hosted with AWS ECS. I use this project as a playground to try out new tools, including AI tools. My favorite so far is Claude Code.

portfolio.name: PROGRAMMING PROBLEMS PORTFOLIO: DATA STRUCTURES AND ALGORTIHMS
portfolio.description: This portfolio collects records of my solutions to various programming problems, mostly related to data structures and algorithms. Most of these problems are from LeetCode, but there are several from other sources. In most cases, I've also included alternative solutions and analyses of my work.

portfolio.name: INTEX 2
portfolio.description: INTEX is a team case competition for each semester the BYU Information Systems junior core. It challenges participants in many tech disciplines, including full-stack development, data communications, cloud infrastructure, cybersecurity, project management, and machine learning. This project is from INTEX April 2024. My team of four members was given four days to build a storefront web application in C# (.NET Framework) with features supported by strong cybersecurity standards and thorough machine learning pipelines. This project was originally deployed with Microsoft Azure.

portfolio.name: INTEX 1
portfolio.description: This project is from INTEX December 2023. My team of four was given four days to build a web application for cities to use to gather and analyze mental health data. The application is written in JavaScript with Node.js and was originally deployed with Amazon Elastic Beanstalk.

portfolio.name: WEBSITE v1.0
portfolio.description: The first iteration of my website. A very simple webdev project from early in my programming education.

portfolio.name: WEBSITE v2.0
portfolio.description: I had a bit more CSS fun with this one. All the art was drawn by me (I'm no artist, so go easy on me!).

interests: I like technology! I think that an understanding of technology is key to being an independent, competent, capable citizen in the 21st century. I feel deeply that I cannot truly understand the world around me if I don't strive to understand the computers that it runs on. That is the philosophy that drove me to study programming and related disciplines. Beyond simply learning the discipline of software engineering for the sake of producing business value, I have an anxious desire to learn the details of what's going on under the hood. How do electrical pulses in a far-flung data center become Breaking Bad streaming on my TV at home? I've learned a lot, but I have more than a lifetime's worth of stuff still to learn. Not knowing how an important technology works makes me uneasy.

I'm very interested in religion. I spent a lot of my university electives on classes covering Judaism, Islam, and various sects of Christianity. I love reading scholarly works about any and every religion, including my own. I love books and films and other artworks of speculative religious fiction or spiritual memoir. I'm fascinated by all sorts of doctrines, liturgies, cultures, and histories.

If you ask any of my friends about me, it won't be long before Star Wars comes up. This saga has claimed an embarrasing amount of my time and money. Like most Star Wars fans, I have a love-hate relationship with the franchise some opinions that would probably baffle you.
I love movies and I try to be cultured beyond my addiction to Star Wars. My favorite films include La La Land, Goodfellas, and more recently, One Battle After Another. See more on my Letterboxd!
